function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Qualitative assessment methods may overlook important numerical metrics that are crucial for understanding the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of system resilience can lead to ineffective strategies for mitigating contagious diseases and increased risk of outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Implement a standardized set of quantitative metrics that capture key aspects of contagious disease spread, and integrate them into resilience assessment procedures.","Technologies":"Data analytics, modeling and simulation tools for disease spread, sensor networks for real-time data collection.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, disease control specialists.","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Lack of domain-specific representation in quantitative resilience approaches may result in overlooking unique factors relevant to contagious disease propagation in different environments.","Impact":"Ineffective resilience measures tailored to specific contagious disease risks, leading to increased vulnerability and spread of diseases.","Mitigation":"Develop domain-specific models and indices that capture the unique characteristics of contagious disease propagation in different built environments.","Technologies":"Machine learning for pattern recognition, geographic information systems for spatial analysis, data mining for identifying risk factors.","People":"Urban planners, architects, public health officials, local government agencies.","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning organizations, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Insufficient consideration of qualitative aspects in quantitative resilience approaches may lead to overlooking the socio-behavioral factors that influence contagious disease spread.","Impact":"Failure to account for human behavior and social dynamics could result in ineffective strategies for controlling disease transmission, leading to increased risk of outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Integrate qualitative data on human behavior and social factors into quantitative models of contagious disease spread, and consider behavioral patterns in resilience assessment.","Technologies":"Social network analysis, sentiment bodies."}]}
